humanTest.description: Human clinical test - add or update

action.description: Value to add a new test or update an existing test.

gtrAccession.description: GTR accession number, for an existing GTR test.

labTestName.description: The name of the test to be displayed in GTR.

testOrderCode.description: The test order code, commonly found on the laboratory's requisition form, test menu or test catalog.

labTestShortName.description: Shortened name or mneumonic used by the lab to identify the test.

manufactureTestName.description: The manufacturer's name for the test, if a commercial test or kit was used.

searchTerms.description: Keywords by which users can search for the test.

targetPopulation.description: Segment(s) of the population that should be tested for the condition or phenotype and why.

citationsForTargetPopulation.description: Citations supporting statements provided in 'Target population for this test'; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

fdaReviews.description: Has the test been reviewed by the FDA?

noReviewCategoryDesignation.description: If no FDA review, FDA category designation

reviewCategoryDesignation.description: If FDA review, FDA category designation.
enum: IUO - Investigational Use Only. The performance characteristics of this product have not been established.
RUO - Research Use Only. Not for use in diagnostic procedures.

reviewItem.description: If FDA reviewed, item under reviewed.
enum: IVDMIA - In Vitro Diagnostic Multivariate Index Assay(s)

otherReviewItem.description: Value if FDA reviewed item is not in the item enum list.

regulatoryStatus.description: If FDA reviewed, FDA regulatory status from enum list.

otherRegulatoryStatus.description: Value if fdaRegulatoryStatus value is not in the status enum list.

fdaApplicationNumber.description: If FDA reviewed, FDA application number.

testDevelopment.description: Information about how the test is developed.
enum: Modified FDA (has FDA-reviewed entry, but with lab modifications/field changes)
Test developed by laboratory (no manufacturer test name)

howToOrder.description: Description of the test ordering procedure.

orderURL.description: The URL for ordering the test.

whoCanOrder.description: One or more types of individuals able to order the test.

testCodeURL.description: The URL for information on codes (e.g. CPT, ICD-9, ICD-10).

loincCodes.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes.

cptCodes.description: Molecular pathology Current Procedural Terminology (CPT®) code - 'MoPath' code - from the American Medical Association (AMA) that describes the test.

informedConsentRequired.description: Whether the lab reqires informed consent prior to performing the test.

pretestGeneticCounselingRequired.description: Requirement by the laboratory for genetic counseling prior to performing the test.

posttestGeneticCounselingRequired.description: Requirement by the laboratory for genetic counseling after performing the test in order to release the test results.

testService.description: Laboratory service that is offered in conjunction with the test, from enum list
enum: Clinical Testing/Confirmation of Mutations Identified Previously

otherService.description: Value if test service is not in the enum list.

comment.description: Helpful information regarding the test service, e.g. how to request the service

testAdditionalServices.description: Additional test service offered in conjunction with the test.

additionalService.description: If applicable, additional laboratory service from enum list.

orderCode.description: Order code for additional test service

comment.description: Enter helpful information regarding the test service, such as how to request the service, limitations, etc.

specimen.description: Specimen sample allowed for the test.

sources.description: Specimen sample source, from enum list

url.description: The URL at lab's website that describes specimen requirements and/or collection protocol.

testingStrategy.description: Description of the clinical testing strategy, not the test procedure; can include prior testing requirements

citationsForTestingStrategy.description: Citations for the testing strategy/algorithm; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://).

testContactPolicies.description: Laboratory policy regarding who may contact lab (e.g., patients and/or health care providers) and when during the testing process the laboratory will discuss tests with patients.

enum: Laboratory can only accept contact from health care providers. Patients/families are encouraged to discuss genetic testing options with their health care provider.
Post-test email/phone consultation regarding genetic test results and interpretation is provided to patients/families.
Pre-test email/phone consultation regarding genetic test results and interpretation is provided to patients/families.

items.description: Lab person name in the format: first-name last-name. The lab person should be in the lab personnel list.

enum: Interpretation performed at an outside lab
Interpretation performed both in-house and at an outside lab
Report generated at an outside lab
Report generated both in-house and at an outside lab
Specimen preparation performed at an outside lab
Specimen preparation performed both in-house and at an outside lab
Wet lab work performed at an outside lab
Wet lab work performed both in-house and at an outside lab

commentForTestPerformanceLocation.description: If any part of the test is performed externally, a description about where it is performed and any other information.

methods.description: Set of method category and primary methodology used in the test; the major method categories for the test which will be inferred from the methodCategory are: (1) Molecular Genetics, (2) Biochemical Genetics, and (3) Cytogenetics.

methodCategory.description: General category to which the test method belongs

otherMethod.description: Value if method is not in the method enum list.

otherInstrument.description: Value if the instrument used is not in the instrument enum list.

platforms.description: The platform used for the test, usually a commercial product (catalog number or set of numbers) with pre-defined test targets used in the test.

name.description: Name of commercial platform or kit with predefined test targets.

otherPlatform.description: Value if platform used is not in the enum list.

testProcedureOrProtocol.description: Summary of the methodology, including specific steps for each method used in the assay.

citationsForTestProcedureOrProtocol.description: Citations supporting the test protocol; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

testResultsConfirmation.description: Information about whether results are confirmed and if so, how.

testComment.description: Optional textual description of the test.

analyticalValidity.description: Quantitative information about analytical sensitivity, analytical specificity, accuracy, and/or precision of this test.

citationsForAnalyticalValidity.description: Citations supporting the analytical validity statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

clinicalValidity.description: Clinical sensitivity and specificity, description of the population(s) assessed, and the number of specimens used to calculate clinical validity.

citationsForClinicalValidity.description: Citations used to evaluate the clinical validity of the test; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

assayLimitations.description: Test limitations that affect the value of the test for its intended use, such as the limit of detection and test restrictions.

citationsForAssayLimitations.description: Citations supporting the assay limitation statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

clinicalUtilities.description: Likelihood of the test to significantly improve patient outcomes.

enum: Guidance for selecting a drug therapy and/or dose
Predictive risk information for patient and/or family members
Sufficient research has not been conducted to demonstrate the utility of the test

otherCategory.description: Value if category is not in the enum list.

url.description: The URL to display references to support a clinical utility choice.

testTargetsAssociated.description: Category describing the condition(s)/phenotype(s) associated with the test target(s) in the test

origins.description: For a given condition or phenotype, whether the test target is germline or somatic or both.

targetsTested.description: The analytes, chromosomal or mitochondrial regions, genes and variations, or proteins that are measured in the test.

proteins.description: Protein; example, 'Hemoglobin subunit beta' or 'Adenomatous polyposis coli protein'

geneWithVariants.description: Relevant gene variant; format is HGVS expression (preferred), or the allele name.

variantClinicalSignificance.description: Value for clinical significance of variant from enum list

citationsForClinicalSignificance.description: Citations used to support the clinical significance of the variant; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

geneWithRefSeqAndExons.description: Relevant reference sequences and exons for each associated reference sequence.

exons.description: For exon range, example 3, 5, 9-12; f the range includes all exons, add (All), example 1-5 (All); if a subset is tested, enumerate the exons tested.

testTargetUnassociated.description: Category describing condition(s)/phenotype(s) and/or test target(s) that are not associated

origins.description: For a given condition or phenotype, whether the test target is germline or somatic or both.

targetsTested.description: The analytes, chromosomal or mitochondrial regions, genes and variations, or proteins that are measured in the test.

proteins.description: Protein; example, 'Hemoglobin subunit beta' or 'Adenomatous polyposis coli protein'

geneWithVariants.description: Relevant gene variant; format is HGVS expression (preferred), or the allele name.

variantClinicalSignificance.description: Value for clinical significance of variant from enum list

citationsForClinicalSignificance.description: Citations used to support the clinical significance of the variant; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

geneWithRefSeqAndExons.description: Relevant reference sequences and exons for each associated reference sequence.

exons.description: For exon range, example 3, 5, 9-12; f the range includes all exons, add (All), example 1-5 (All); if a subset is tested, enumerate the exons tested.

protocolForInterpretingVariationAsVUS.description: Method used by the lab to interpret a variation as VUS.

softwareUsedToInterpretNovelVariations.description: Software used by the lab to interpret novel variations.

labPolicyOnReportingNovelVariations.description: A description of how the lab reports novel variations.

areFamilyMembersRecruitedWithoutCharge.description: Whether the lab offers testing for a variant of unknown significance to family members free of charge; for example, to affected individuals and/or presumed obligate carriers to help determine clinical significance of a VUS.

commentsAboutRecruitingFamilyMembers.description: Explanation of who is eligible to testing free of charge and how the lab does it; for example, is the testing offered to affected individuals and/or presumed obligate carriers to help determine clinical significance of a VUS.

willLabRecontactOrderingPhysicanIfVarian.description: Whether the lab contacts the ordering physician after testing and initial report, if a variant interpretation changes.

commentsAboutRecontactingOrderingPhysica.description: An explanation about how the lab monitors and addresses reinterpretation of genetic tests results over time, after issuing the report; for example, time limit if any, whether the laboratory systematically re-evaluates prior interpretations and generate new reports, or whether the person ordering the test needs to periodically recontact the laboratory to inquire about changes in test interpretation.

researchPerformedAfterClinicalTestingIsC.description: An explanation or information about any research testing being performed using the submitted sample; for example, research testing is allowed under IRB approved protocols or the patient would have to sign an informed consent for the research protocol; if the protocol is registered in clinicaltials.gov, you can enter that information here.

proficiencyTesting.description: Periodic internal or external evaluation of the test to corroborate the accuracy of test results.

method.description: The type of proficiency testing that is performed, from enum list.

otherMethod.description: Value if method is not in the method enum list.

methodDescription.description: A description of the proficiency testing method used.

citationsForMethodDescription.description: Citations to support the proficiency testing method statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

provider.description: Provider for proficiency testing, from enum list.
enum: American College of Medical Genetics / College of American Pathologists, ACMG/CAP
American College of Physicians - Medical Laboratory Evaluation, ACP MLE
Belgian Official EKE Schemes, GLP Monitoring Programme
Canadian External Quality Assessment Laboratory, CEQAL
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Newborn Screening Quality Assurance Program, CDC DLS
European Concerted Action on Thrombosis External Quality Assessment Program, ECAT EQAP
European Molecular Genetics Quality Network, EMQN
European Research Network for the Evaluation and Improvement of Screening Diagnosis and Treatment of Inherited Metabolic Disorders - External Quality Assessment Schemes, ERNDIM EQAS
External Quality Assessment for Molecular Genetic Testing for Phenylketonuria, EQA-PKU
Human Genetic Society of Australasia, HGSA
Institute for Standardization and Documentation in the Medical Laboratory, INSTAND
Pacific Northwest Regional Genetics Group, PacNoRGG
Society for Inherited Metabolic Disorders, SIMD

otherProvider.description: Value if provider is not in the provider enum list.

internalTestValidationMethod.description: Explanation of how the lab validates the test.

citationsForInternalTestValidationMethod.description: Citations to support internal test validation method statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275';; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

caps.description: Set of mjaor category, sub-category and test code to specify, if College of American Pathologists (CAP) is chosen as Provider for proficiency testing.

majorCapCategory.description: Category to specify, if College of American Pathologists (CAP) is chosen as Provider for proficiency testing

capCategory.description: Relevant sub-category, if major CAP category is selected.

capTest.description: Relevant test code, if major CAP category is selected.

microbeTest.description: Add or update a clinical microbe test.

action.description: Specify to add a new test or update an existing test.

gtrAccession.description: If this test has been registered previously in the GTR, enter the GTR accession number here. This is required for update.

labTestName.description: The name of the test to be displayed in GTR.

testOrderCode.description: The test order code, commonly found on the laboratory's requisition form, test menu or test catalog.

labTestShortName.description: Shortened name or mneumonic used by the lab to identify the test.

manufactureTestName.description: The manufacturer's name for the test, if a commercial test or kit was used.

searchTerms.description: Keywords by which users can search for the test.

targetPopulation.description: Segment(s) of the population that should be tested for the condition or phenotype and why.

citationsForTargetPopulation.description: Citations supporting statements provided in 'Target population for this test'; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

fdaReviews.description: Has the test been reviewed by the FDA?

noReviewCategoryDesignation.description: If no FDA review, specify FDA category designation

reviewCategoryDesignation.description: If FDA review, specify FDA category designation
enum: IUO - Investigational Use Only. The performance characteristics of this product have not been established.
RUO - Research Use Only. Not for use in diagnostic procedures.

reviewItem.description: If FDA reviewed, item under reviewed.
enum: IVDMIA - In Vitro Diagnostic Multivariate Index Assay(s)

otherReviewItem.description: If FDA reviewed item is not in the item enum list, please specify.

regulatoryStatus.description: If FDA reviewed, FDA regulatory status from enum list.

otherRegulatoryStatus.description: If fdaRegulatoryStatus value is not in the status enum list, please specify.

fdaApplicationNumber.description: If FDA reviewed, FDA application number.

testDevelopment.description: Information about how the test is developed.
enum: Modified FDA (has FDA-reviewed entry, but with lab modifications/field changes)
Test developed by laboratory (no manufacturer test name)

howToOrder.description: Description of the test ordering procedure.

orderURL.description: The URL for ordering the test.

sampleRequirement.description: Instructions for proper processing of the sample, including collection, sample container, volume, storage, temperature, causes for rejection, days that samples may or may not be received.

specimen.description: Specimen sample allowed for the test.

sources.description: Specimen sample source, from enum list

otherSource.description: Value if specimen source is not in the provider enum list

url.description: The URL at lab's website that describes specimen requirements and/or collection protocol.

zCode.description: Z-Code Identifier for this test. 5-character alpha-numeric code associated with certain molecular diagnostics (MDx) tests used in addition to the CPT code, to help payers and providers clearly understand which test is being ordered, performed, and billed.

turnaroundTime.description: The usual number of hours or days between the time a specimen is received and a result is released. Specify the time unit (e.g. 2-3 days).

testCodeURL.description: The URL for information on codes (e.g. CPT, ICD-9, ICD-10).

loincCodes.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes.

cptCodes.description: Molecular pathology Current Procedural Terminology (CPT®) code - 'MoPath' code - from the American Medical Association (AMA) that describes the test.

whoCanOrder.description: One or more types of individuals who are able to order the test.

informedConsentRequired.description: Whether the lab reqires informed consent prior to performing the test.

testServices.description: Laboratory service that is offered in conjunction with the test, from enum list

otherService.description: Value if test service is not in the enum list

comment.description: Helpful information regarding the test service, e.g., how to request the service.

testingStrategy.description: Description of the clinical testing strategy, not the test procedure; can include prior testing requirements

citationsForTestingStrategy.description: Citations for the testing strategy/algorithm; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://).

testContactPolicies.description: Laboratory policy regarding who may contact lab (e.g., patients and/or health care providers) and when during the testing process the laboratory will discuss tests with patients.

enum: Laboratory can only accept contact from health care providers. Patients/families are encouraged to discuss testing options with their health care provider.
Post-test email/phone consultation regarding test results and interpretation is provided to patients/families.
Pre-test email/phone consultation regarding test results and interpretation is provided to patients/families.

items.description: Lab person name in the format: first-name last-name. The lab person should be in the lab personnel list.

commentForTestPerformanceLocation.description: If any part of the test is performed externally, describe here which part(s) and where part(s) are performed.

methods.description: Set of method category and primary methodology used in the test; the major method categories for the test which will be inferred from the methodCategory are: (1) Molecular Genetics, and (2) Serology

methodCategory.description: General category to which the test method belongs

otherMethod.description: Value if method is not in the method enum list.

otherInstrument.description: Value if instrument used is not in the instrument enum list.

platforms.description: The platform used for the test, usually a commercial product (catalog number or set of numbers) with pre-defined test targets used in the test.

name.description: Name of commercial platform or kit with predefined test targets.

otherPlatform.description: Value if platform used is not in the enum list.

testProcedureOrProtocol.description: Summary of the methodology, including specific steps for each method used in the assay.

citationsForTestProcedureOrProtocol.description: Citations supporting the test protocol; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

testResultsConfirmation.description: Information about whether results are confirmed and if so, how.

testComment.description: Optional textual description of the test.

analyticalValidity.description: Quantitative information about analytical sensitivity, analytical specificity, accuracy, and/or precision of this test.

citationsForAnalyticalValidity.description: Citations supporting the analytical validity statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

positiveAndNegativePredictiveValuesOrPPV.description: Positive Predictive Value (PPV) is the probability of true disease when the result is positive. Negative Predictive Value (NPV) is the probability of no disease when the result is negative

citationsForPPVAndNPV.description: Citations used to evaluate PPV/NPV of the test; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

clinicalValidity.description: A measure of how consistently and accurately the test detects or predicts the intermediate or final outcomes of interest. Clinical sensitivity and specificity, description of the population(s) assessed, and the number of specimens are used to calculate clinical validity.

citationsForClinicalValidity.description: Citations used to evaluate the clinical validity of the test; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

assayLimitations.description: Test limitations that affect the value of the test for its intended use, such as the limit of detection and test restrictions.

citationsForAssayLimitations.description: Citations supporting the assay limitation statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

minimalMicrobeLoadTestCanDetect.description: Limit of detection or the microbe load below which the test cannot reliably detect the microbe; e.g., viral loads < 20 copies/ml cannot be reliably detected and will be reported as 'below the limit of detection').

citationsForMinimalMicrobeLoadTestCanDet.description: Citations supporting the minimal microbial load s statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

clinicalUtilities.description: Likelihood of the test is to significantly improve patient outcomes.

enum: Guidance for selecting a drug therapy and/or dose
Sufficient research has not been conducted to demonstrate the utility of the test

otherCategory.description: Value if category is not in the enum list.

url.description: The URL to display references to support a clinical utility choice.

conditionsOrPhenotypes.description: The condition or phenotype relevant to the eligibility criteria and/or study aims for the test, provided as either a database identifier or a name.

ontologyDb.description: Databases supporting the classification and standardized nomenclature and coding of human conditions and phenotypes with a genetic basis: OMIM - Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man®; MedGen - Medical Genetics resource (National Center for Biotechnology Information; NCBI); HPO - Human Phenotype Ontology (The Jackson Laboratory); Orphanet (Orphanet / INSERM); MeSH - Medical Subject Headings (NCBI); MONDO (EMBL - EBI); select from enum list.

labPreferredName.description: The preferred name of the condition or phenotype that is referred to by the laboratory.

synonyms.description: The synonym of the condition or phenotype.

labPreferredAcronym.description: The acronym for the condition or phenotype that is referred to by the laboratory.

acronyms.description: Your laboratory's preferred acronym for the condition.

prevalenceDescription.description: Prevalence or the most current estimated number of cases of the disease in the population.

testTargets.description: The microorganism(s) and their genes, variants, proteins, analytes, and/or extrachromosomal or nucleic acid sequences that are measured in the test.

microbeType.description: Type of microorganism, from the enum list.

genes.description: Microbial gene(s) measured in the test.

variants.description: Microbial gene variant(s) measured in the test.

analytes.description: Microbial analyte(s) measured in the test.

chromosomalRegionOrMitochondrions.description: Microbial chromosomal region, mitochondrion, extrachromosomal elements, and/or nucleic acid sequences measured in the test.

proteins.description: Microbial protein(s) measured in the test.

proficiencyTesting.description: Periodic internal or external evaluation of the test to corroborate the accuracy of test results.

method.description: The type of proficiency testing that is performed, from enum list.

citationsForMethodDescription.description: Citations to support the proficiency testing method statement; for PubMed ID use format 'PMID: 23193275'; for URL, begin with the protocol (e.g. https://)

primary.description: The flag of whether the name of the condition or phenotype is primary in the test. Each test can have only one primary condition or phenotype.

citationsForPrevalence.description: Citations to support the prevalence statement. Provide PubMed ID when available (example 'PMID: 23193275').
